cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast on Thursday and move parallel to the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts, remaining just offshore while accelerating northeastward toward the outer banks of North Carolina and then the Virginia Capes before heading for Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, and the tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point southward (Tropical Storm); Flagler/Volusia County FL line to Poquoson VA including Hampton Roads (Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from Florida through Virginia, including Hampton Roads and the southern Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (forecast 3–6 inches for far SE Virginia)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft inundation forecast for Hampton Roads)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible Friday with a 38% chance of 34 kt and a 7% chance of 50 kt sustained winds at Norfolk/Port of Virginia.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 2–4 ft above ground is forecast for Hampton Roads and the lower Chesapeake Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain could cause flash flooding in the port region Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and dangerous surf, rip currents, and the risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands.
